oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military Permit for Hannah Morey
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: “Hq 2rd Army of Ky. Franklin Tenn. May 22, 1863. Permit Mrs Maury to purchase goods For her own & family use – By order of Maj Gen G. Granger WmL Avery Capt. et. D. C. To Messrs Priest & Sinclair”
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Small handwritten document permitting Hannah Morey to purchase goods for her family. The permit is signed by Union General Gordon Granger of the Army of Kentucky. Hannah Herrick Morey was the wife of the Rev. Ira Morey and the mother of James Marsh Morey.

Gordon Granger (18221876) was a career U.S. army officer and a Union general during the Civil War. He was promoted to major general of volunteers on September 17, 1862, and took command of the Army of Kentucky. He conducted cavalry operations in central Tennessee before his command was merged into the Army of the Cumberland, becoming the Reserve Corps. He is most famous for his actions commanding the Reserve Corps at the Battle of Chickamauga.
